patterns.name: Minority Attack
patterns.description: Attack the opponent's pawn majority with your minority to create weaknesses
key_ideas: Push b4-b5 to attack opponent's c6 pawn
Double rooks on b-file for pressure
Force opponent to either capture or defend passively
Create weak squares and backward pawns

patterns.name: Kingside Pawn Storm
patterns.description: Push pawns toward the opponent's castled king to open lines for attack
key_ideas: Push pawns to open files/diagonals
Create weaknesses in opponent's pawn shield
Coordinate pieces behind the pawn advance
Race to attack before opponent's counterplay

patterns.name: Central Pawn Break
patterns.description: Break central tension with pawn advance to open lines and activate pieces
key_ideas: Open lines for bishops and rooks
Gain space advantage
Create passed pawns
Activate dormant pieces

patterns.name: File Opening and Pressure
patterns.description: Open a file and double rooks to create pressure on opponent's position
key_ideas: Place rooks on open/semi-open file
Double rooks for maximum pressure
Target weak pawns or pieces
Penetrate to 7th or 8th rank if possible

patterns.name: Piece Trade Simplification
patterns.description: Trade pieces when ahead to reach a winning endgame
key_ideas: Trade pieces, not pawns
Reduce opponent's counterplay
Simplify to technically winning endgame
Keep pieces that complement your advantages

patterns.name: Knight Outpost Establishment
patterns.description: Place a knight on a strong, unassailable square deep in opponent's position
key_ideas: Identify squares opponent cannot control with pawns
Maneuver knight to outpost
Support outpost with pawns/pieces
Use outpost as base for further operations
